verses.verse: Keep <WH8104> thy foot <WH7272> when <WH834> thou goest <WH1980> to <WH413> the house <WH1004> of God, <WH430> and be more ready <WH7126> to hear, <WH8085> than to give <WH4480> <WH5414> the sacrifice <WH2077> of fools: <WH3684> for they consider <WH3045> not <WH369> that <WH3588> they do <WH6213> evil. <WH7451>

Be not <WH408> rash <WH926> with <WH5921> thy mouth, <WH6310> and let not <WH408> thine heart <WH3820> be hasty <WH4116> to utter <WH3318> any thing <WH1697> before <WH6440> God: <WH430> for <WH3588> God <WH430> is in heaven, <WH8064> and thou <WH859> upon <WH5921> earth: <WH776> therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> let thy words <WH1697> be <WH1961> few. <WH4592>
For <WH3588> a dream <WH2472> cometh <WH935> through the multitude <WH7230> of business; <WH6045> and a fool's <WH3684> voice <WH6963> is known by multitude <WH7230> of words. <WH1697>

When <WH834> thou vowest <WH5087> a vow <WH5088> unto God, <WH430> defer <WH309> not <WH408> to pay <WH7999> it; for <WH3588> he hath no <WH369> pleasure <WH2656> in fools: <WH3684> pay <WH7999> <WH853> that which <WH834> thou hast vowed. <WH5087>
Better <WH2896> is it that <WH834> thou shouldest not <WH3808> vow, <WH5087> than that thou shouldest vow <WH4480> <WH7945> <WH5087> and not <WH3808> pay. <WH7999>

Suffer <WH5414> not <WH408> <WH853> thy mouth <WH6310> to cause <WH853> thy flesh <WH1320> to sin; <WH2398> neither <WH408> say <WH559> thou before <WH6440> the angel, <WH4397> that <WH3588> it <WH1931> was an error: <WH7684> wherefore <WH4100> should God <WH430> be angry <WH7107> at <WH5921> thy voice, <WH6963> and destroy <WH2254> <WH853> the work <WH4639> of thine hands? <WH3027>
For <WH3588> in the multitude <WH7230> of dreams <WH2472> and many <WH7235> words <WH1697> there are also divers vanities: <WH1892> but <WH3588> fear <WH3372> thou <WH853> God. <WH430>

If <WH518> thou seest <WH7200> the oppression <WH6233> of the poor, <WH7326> and violent perverting <WH1499> of judgment <WH4941> and justice <WH6664> in a province, <WH4082> marvel <WH8539> not <WH408> at <WH5921> the matter: <WH2656> for <WH3588> he that is higher <WH1364> than <WH4480> <WH5921> the highest <WH1364> regardeth; <WH8104> and there be higher <WH1364> than <WH5921> they.
Moreover the profit <WH3504> of the earth <WH776> is for all: <WH3605> the king <WH4428> himself is served <WH5647> by the field. <WH7704>

He that loveth <WH157> silver <WH3701> shall not <WH3808> be satisfied <WH7646> with silver; <WH3701> nor he <WH4310> that loveth <WH157> abundance <WH1995> with increase: <WH8393> this <WH2088> is also <WH1571> vanity. <WH1892>

When goods <WH2896> increase, <WH7235> they are increased <WH7231> that eat <WH398> them: and what <WH4100> good <WH3788> is there to the owners <WH1167> thereof, saving <WH3588> <WH518> the beholding <WH7200> of them with their eyes? <WH5869>

The sleep <WH8142> of a laboring man <WH5647> is sweet, <WH4966> whether <WH518> he eat <WH398> little <WH4592> or <WH518> much: <WH7235> but the abundance <WH7647> of the rich <WH6223> will not <WH369> suffer <WH5117> him to sleep. <WH3462>

There is <WH3426> a sore <WH2470> evil <WH7451> which I have seen <WH7200> under <WH8478> the sun, <WH8121> namely, riches <WH6239> kept <WH8104> for the owners <WH1167> thereof to their hurt. <WH7451>
But those <WH1931> riches <WH6239> perish <WH6> by evil <WH7451> travail: <WH6045> and he begetteth <WH3205> a son, <WH1121> and there is nothing <WH369> <WH3972> in his hand. <WH3027>

As <WH834> he came forth <WH3318> of his mother's <WH517> womb, <WH4480> <WH990> naked <WH6174> shall he return <WH7725> to go <WH1980> as he came, <WH7945> <WH935> and shall take <WH5375> nothing <WH3808> <WH3972> of his labor, <WH5999> which he may carry way <WH7945> <WH1980> in his hand. <WH3027>

And this <WH2090> also <WH1571> is a sore <WH2470> evil, <WH7451> that in all <WH3605> points <WH5980> as he came, <WH7945> <WH935> so <WH3651> shall he go: <WH1980> and what <WH4100> profit <WH3504> hath he that hath labored <WH7945> <WH5998> for the wind? <WH7307>
All <WH3605> his days <WH3117> also <WH1571> he eateth <WH398> in darkness, <WH2822> and he hath much <WH7235> sorrow <WH3707> and wrath <WH7110> with his sickness. <WH2483>

Behold <WH2009> that which <WH834> I <WH589> have seen: <WH7200> it is good <WH2896> and comely <WH3303> for one to eat <WH398> and to drink, <WH8354> and to enjoy <WH7200> the good <WH2896> of all <WH3605> his labor <WH5999> that he taketh <WH7945> <WH5998> under <WH8478> the sun <WH8121> all <WH4557> the days <WH3117> of his life, <WH2416> which <WH834> God <WH430> giveth <WH5414> him: for <WH3588> it <WH1931> is his portion. <WH2506>

Every <WH3605> man <WH120> also <WH1571> to whom <WH834> God <WH430> hath given <WH5414> riches <WH6239> and wealth, <WH5233> and hath given him power <WH7980> to eat <WH398> thereof, <WH4480> and to take <WH5375> <WH853> his portion, <WH2506> and to rejoice <WH8055> in his labor; <WH5999> this <WH2090> is the gift <WH4991> of God. <WH430>

For <WH3588> he shall not <WH3808> much <WH7235> remember <WH2142> <WH853> the days <WH3117> of his life; <WH2416> because <WH3588> God <WH430> answereth <WH6030> him in the joy <WH8057> of his heart. <WH3820>
